meanings.definition: A structure built parallel to the bank of a waterway for use as a landing place.
meanings.sent1: The quaysides were bustling with activity as boats docked to unload their cargo.
meanings.sent2: People enjoy strolling along the quaysides, watching the boats come and go.
meanings.sent3: The seagull perched on the quaysides, pretending to be a ship captain.
meanings.sent4: The quaysides stood like welcoming arms, embracing the incoming vessels.
meanings.sent5: The sunlight danced on the quaysides, creating a picturesque scene.

meanings.definition: The area alongside a quay or wharf.
meanings.sent1: Tourists gathered at the quaysides to admire the view of the harbor.
meanings.sent2: The shops along the quaysides offered a variety of souvenirs for visitors.
meanings.sent3: Children played hide-and-seek among the quaysides, giggling with delight.
meanings.sent4: The lights from the nearby buildings reflected on the quaysides, illuminating the night.
meanings.sent5: The sound of seagulls echoed through the quaysides, adding to the maritime atmosphere.
